Use Case: Associate cohort with Program of Study
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can assign a cohort to a specific Program of Study offered by the department.

Use Case: Add a listing of students to a cohort
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add a list of students to a designated cohort.

Use Case: Add a single student to a cohort
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add an individual student to an existing cohort.

Use Case: Be eligible for Program of Study
Description: Students added to a cohort become eligible for that cohort's associated Program of Study.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can define the preferred class sequence for a specific cohort.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can assign specific quarters in which classes in a sequence will be offered.

Use Case: Add new classes to class sequence
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add new classes to an existing sequence for a cohort.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add clinical classes or sections to a class sequence.

Use Case: Add a new cohort to the system
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add a new cohort identified by its start month and year.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add new classes specifically for the nursing department.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can classify a class as clinical or non-clinical.
Instructors define non-clinical class details, such as course name, room needs, and instructor requirements.
Instructors provide clinical class details, including course name, room needs, clinical site, and instructor needs.

Use Case: Create a new Program of Study
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can create a new Program of Study with required clinical and non-clinical classes.
A Program of Study includes a program name and a list of required clinical and non-clinical classes.

Use Case: Specify required classes for Program of Study
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can define which classes are required for a Program of Study.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can view a report showing needed classes for a specific quarter for all cohorts.
The report includes information on classes, number of sections, labs, and room types needed for a quarter.
Classes for a cohort should not have conflicting schedules (i.e., overlap in time or day).
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add new clinical sites to the system.
Clinical Site Administrators provide site details, including name, contact person, and contact information.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add a new clinical lab section for an existing clinical class.
Instructors specify the clinical lab section details, including site name, class instructor, day, and time of lab.

Use Case: Add student to clinical lab section
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can assign students registered for a clinical class to a clinical lab section.

Use Case: Remove student from clinical lab section
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can remove students from a clinical lab section.

Use Case: Move student between clinical lab sections
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can move students between clinical lab sections of the same clinical class.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can cancel a clinical lab section only if no students are registered.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can add new nursing students to the system.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can manage part-time students' progress, including adjusting their class sequence and timeline.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can generate a printable summary of cohort progress, including students, program, class sequence, and timeline.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can generate a summary of labs held at a clinical site for a given quarter.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can generate a summary of clinical labs, including students, instructors, and scheduling information.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can generate a printable summary of individual nursing students, including name, ID, GPA, and cohort.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can view and print a summary of the system log for review and auditing purposes.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can maintain contact information for all relevant individuals, such as staff, students, and instructors.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members use stored email addresses to communicate with students, staff, and instructors.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members inform students about their upcoming class schedule.

Use Case: Notify affected parties about clinical changes
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members notify students and instructors of changes to clinical sections (e.g., cancellations, capacity changes).

Use Case: Notify affected parties about class changes
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members inform students and instructors about class schedule changes.

Use Case: Notify affected parties about cohort changes
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members inform students of cohort schedule changes (e.g., lab cancellations).

Use Case: Notify affected parties about individual student status changes
Description: Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members inform students of status changes (e.g., from full-time to part-time) and clinical section adjustments.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can update cohort details, including identifier, program of study, class sequence, and class timing.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can update Program of Study details, including required courses and class sequence.
Clinical Site Administrators can update clinical site details, including the name, contact person, and address.
Instructors can modify information related to a clinical lab section, including the clinical site, class instructor, and lab schedule.
Program Administrators and Nursing Staff Members can update details about nursing students, such as their ID, name, contact information, and enrollment status.
